import scrapy


class BooksSpider(scrapy.Spider):
name = 'books'
allowed_domains=['books.toscrape.com']
start_urls = ['https://books.toscrape.com/']

def parse(self, response):
books = response.css('ol.row li')
for url in books:
url = url.css('div.image_container a::attr(href)').get()
url=response.urljoin(url)
yield scrapy.Request(url,callback=self.parse_books)

def parse_books(self,response):
yield {
'title':response.css('div>h1::text').get().strip(),
'catagories':response.css('ul.breadcrumb>:nth-child(3)>a::text').get().strip()
}
next_page = response.css('.next > a::attr(href)').get()
if next_page:
next_page=response.urljoin(next_page)
yield scrapy.Request(next_page, callback=self.parse_books)


Note: I used the same script on other sites it works fine.

Comment: 5:50 root element /
6:20 (only the direct) child /
7:23 find element with //
9:38 (great)grandchildren // (Common mistake: selecting a child / does not select grandchildren // )
16:14 change directory to the parent (one level up) ..
18:36 attributes @
> 19:53 element node vs attribute node
21:10 get the text of an element node with the function text()
23:38 filtering to select the 2nd element a[2] (indexing begins with 1)
27:12 filtering by a specific attribute a[@id="first"]
31:00 find all elements with an attribute //a[@class]
32:09 find an element by the text in it //a[text()="second one nexted inside h2"]
32:51 for exact or partial match contains(where you're looking for something - text, class etc, "what you're looking for") e.g. //a[contains( text(), "second one" )]
37:00 select all descendants //h2/descendant::*
37:45 specific descendants //h2/descendant::a
38:20 any element that contains a specific class //*[@class="anchor"] ; and you can get text from it //*[@class="anchor"]/text()
39:45 child //h2/child::a (not that useful)
40:55 get the last element of a selection //a[last()] ; you can also do //a[last()-1] NB: within same parent group!
46:30 custom attributes can also be filtered //a[@data-quantity>3 and @class="blue"]
52:09 sibling //a[@id="first"]/following-sibling::a
